text: everyone knows you make pesto with basil
not this time actually pesto means paste
so anything you turn into a paste can be
considered pesto and the classic is
certainly basil with pine nuts parmesan
garlic but what we're gonna do here
today is make pesto with asparagus
I usually peel asparagus before I cook
it because the peel can be a little bit
on the tough side but since you're gonna
puree it you don't need to do that and
the great thing about that is that the
peel has a lot of flavor in it so when
we puree it we're gonna get all that
asparagus flavor mixed with sort of
classic pesto flavorings garlic pine
nuts Parmesan gonna add a little bit of
lemon and I've got some fish slow
cooking in the oven we would just put
that asparagus pesto on top of that it's
a sort of gorgeous vegetable topping but
really this stuff is great on anything
you can put it on chicken and pasta put
on ice cream whatever you want I cooked
this asparagus as you see I just cut it
into two inch lengths trim the bottom
cut it into two inch lengths cooked it
for seven or eight minutes let me show
you this here's a typical piece of this
cooked asparagus how you know it's done
watch this the weight of the knife I'm
not pressing at all goes in that's gonna
puree really easily we may need a little
liquid to get the machine going which is
why I have saved some of the cooking
liquid from the asparagus but we may not
we'll see because different amount
different asparagus has different
amounts of liquid in it
kind of gorgeous put in some olive oil
when I say some I mean a lot salt put in
a clove of garlic now I want that well
pureed this is you know you can make
pesto with sort of a granular texture
it's gonna be a little smoother really
well parade nice some pine nuts Parmesan
I am doing this most definitely doing
this to paste and the parmesan will
thicken that up a little bit that's
super tiny bit more lemon nothing else
actually almost the same thing with the
fish is with the asparagus does the
knife meet resistance
no no it's done and for those of you who
are curious I cooked this fish by
putting just the film of water really
1/8 1/8 of an inch of water in the
bottom of this dish with a lump of
butter a couple tablespoons of butter
fish on that salt and pepper on there
350 400 degrees until the fish is done
which in this case was about 12 minutes
come on little guy mmm not quite pure
asparagus flavor really intense
asparagus flavor but certainly moderated
by the parmesan the garlic the olive oil
and the pine nuts giving some crunch
really beautiful
